ratings.comment: He totally makes the course, and the course is pretty fantastic. If you have any thoughts on banking, this course really helps you understand how banks work and what people in them are thinking. Very useful and great prof.
By far my favorite professor at UW. Pretty easy workload/grade too.

Take this as your finance elective. Very interesting and useful class. Prof Johannes's stories are relevant and connects his experiences in his career to the class. They are usually hilarious, which is always good. Always go to class and don't skip an exam, even though you have that option. Light workload. Top 3 professor at Madison.
Johannas is the man.  Best professor I've ever had, and he's still working as a banker.  His stories are awesome and keep everyone engaged and often times laughing.  Take his classes.

Professor Johannes is by far the best professor I've ever had. Lectures are engaging and entertaining, and he does a fantastic job relating banking concepts to the real world. I was wary about being a banker at the beginning of the semester, but now, I couldn't be more excited. Definitely take a course with him if you can. You won't regret it.

Possibly my favorite business class to date. I never missed a lecture because they all felt worthwhile. Jim likes to tell stories and he and Bob are plenty entertaining all-around. Project is simple for the most part if you can follow directions; he spells it all out for you really. Exams were a little tricky, but he lets you use a formula sheet.
Very entertaining, inspiring, and practical course I've ever studied had a great influence which changes my mind at all about being an auditor. Heading to banking!!
Professor Johannes was very good at making lectures entertaining and worth going to.

not the easiest class but doable. going to lecture doesn't help too much but make you understand the examples and equations he uses in lecture (posts powerpoints online). do the practice quizzes and understand those before the tests and quizzes. they helped a bunch. and everyone can do the math problems so make sure you can too!
Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had... enough said.  Any class taught by Johannes is a must take.

Makes lectures interesting, but I found them not really worth my time. Despite being a finance course, his exams focus on theoretical questions regarding finance and isn't similar to any homework he assigns. Exams and quizzes are multiple choice, so if you are good at guessing you will do well in this class.

I took this class as the finance requirements <400 and didn't realize I'd have one of the best professors on campus. He's SUCH a clear lecturer, using simple examples to explain complex banking concepts. His exams are a little tricky, but his curve is decent and he allows you one side of a sheet of paper for formulas. Hilarious storyteller too.

James Johannes is the reason that I want to become a banker. He clearly explain course concepts, relations, and applications to the real world and is incredibly charming while doing it. I felt guilty missing classes because he explained things so well.

Best finance teacher in Madison.  Don't miss class! He makes things interesting and relates them to real life.  I would take any class with him I could.  He's engaging, funny and relatable.  The type of professor you'd want to run into at a bar.

Best applied knowledge course I've had yet, you actually learn real stuff in this class! This is the kind of course you'd expect more of from a top tier school. Whether you do well or not in this class you'll still get a lot out of it and that's really worth something.

Great professor...very engaging and helpful! Tells a lot of memorable stories that help you remember the material. Semester project is an easy A for 25% of your grade. Exams aren't too bad. Good course to take to fulfill the required Finance elective.

This is general business for the non-business major, and Johannes was awesome! He's extremely intelligent and knowledgeable and it shows. The only thing in the lecture hall that made me wary was sitting in the front row and hearing him shout while waving his "yield curve" (aka yard stick) around my face. Take any class you can with him! Great prof!
Really great teacher and great course! For sure my favorite at UW! Funny and helpful!
Great class, interesting discussion. I would take this class if you are at all interested in Banking.
Great professor! Really makes the material interesting!
I took the second course with only 15 people, but it was my favorite course at UW.  You run your own bank, have a golf outing as the final, and interesting discussions on bank derivatives and M&A.

Great professor with awesome stories about his times working as a bank director.  I regretted missing 2 lectures.  The curve for his class is kind of difficult so don't slack off on the project or exams, although easier than many sob courses.

Without a doubt THE best lecturer I've ever had.  The curves on exams were kind of tight, but he presents information in a way that makes everything understandable.  This was the only class I didn't skip one day all semester...very engaging professor.

The best professor I've ever had. I only took this class because I needed a breadth requirement and he blew me away. Obviously knows his material and cares about the subject as well. He has real world experience that is entertaining and informative. Take this class if you can!!!
Most engaging and interesting professor I've ever had. Hands down.
